oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of thoracic ultrasonography and thoracic radiography to detect lung lesions in hospitalized dairy calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Berman, J.
Fecteau, G.
Francoz, D.
Buczinski, S.
Masseau, I.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lung lesions
thoracic ultrasonography
radiography
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The detection of lung lesions in dairy calves is commonly achieved using thoracic ultrasonography (TUS) and radiography (TR). However, it remains unclear from the literature if one diagnostic procedure is superior to another. The main objective of this study was therefore to evaluate the sensitivity (Se) and specificity (Sp) of TUS and TR to detect lung lesions in dairy calves with the hypothesis that TUS and TR have similar Se and Sp.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 342
